alert.note: Alert for Cumberland; Prince Edward (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:50PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Cumberland and northwestern Prince Edward Counties through 445 PM EDT... At 350 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Toga to near Spout Spring. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail. Rainfall up to 1 inch. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Farmville around 435 PM EDT. Darlington Heights and Prospect around 440 PM EDT. Hampden Sydney around 445 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Raines Tavern, Tuggle, Elam, Reeds, Hawk and Allens Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
